column40: 3663 were in need of assistance. 909 housholds were effected. Roads, water supply systems, electricity networks; medical oxygen production facility threatened; Red Cross HQ damaged. Agricultural land flooded; >100 livestock drowned; livelihoods damaged in multiple municipalities. 300 people evacuated.

column40: The outbreak of measles in Bosnia and Herzegovina began at the beginning of 2024. Initially, in January and February 2024 the highest number of cases was recorded in Bijeljina, Banja Luka, and the Tuzla Canton, specifically in the cities of Tuzla and Å½ivinice. Subsequently, the number increased in the Sarajevo Canton, especially in the mid March where it is still on the rise. Measles cases have also been reported in the BrÄko District of BiH

column40: Due to extremely low temperatures followed by a heavy snow-fall approximately twenty municipalities have been cut off from the rest of the country. The snow blast took place from early Thursday, 2nd February 2012 and since then it has continued snowing. The most affected municipalities are Han Pijesak, Sokolac, ?ajni?e, Srebrenica, Kalinovik, Istocni Stari Grad and Kladanj. Blocked roads, power shortages and broken communication lines made it almost impossible to reach the affected areas. The Government of Bosnia and Herzegovina has declared state of emergency because of the situation in the affected areas.

column9: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)
column26: Sarajevo (Dobrinja), Doboj, Zenica, Zvornik, Foča, Gacko (Fazlagić Kula), Sokolac, Istočna Hercegovina
column40: Extremely low temperatures and a shortage of gas are having a severe impact on the coping mechanisms of already vulnerable groups of the population. They are in need of heating and food since their financial resources have been spent on alternative heating.
